title: Ticket #2736: schedd tries to kill pid 0 and then excepts
description:
Igor upgraded from 7.6.4 to 7.6.5 and within a few minutes, the schedd crashed with the following message: 

12/30/11 15:09:49 (pid:16798) Match record (glidein_16149@cmsrm-wn089.roma1.infn.it <141.108.36.47:58527?CCBID=169.228.130.23:9677#8728&noUDP> for uscms2783, 366716.79) deleted
12/30/11 15:09:49 (pid:16798) ERROR "Send_Signal: sent unsafe pid (0)" at line 5492 in file /home/condor/execute/dir_10444/userdir/src/condor_daemon_core.V6/daemon_core.cpp

Looking at code changes in the schedd in 7.6.5, I am betting that the problem is caused by #2706, because that code adds a new call to Send_Signal() in the schedd.
remarks:
2012-Jan-03 16:31:35 by jfrey:
It would be easy to add a guard on the new Send_Signal() call to ensure the pid is > 0. But I'd like to understand why the pid is 0. I've looked over the code and the pid should be valid any time that code fires.

2012-Jan-04 16:31:57 by jfrey:
I understand what's happening now. There's a window of time when a shadow_rec exists before the shadow process is spawned. During that time, the pid field of the shadow_rec is 0 and the status field of the match_rec is M_ACTIVE.

2012-Jan-04 19:20:36 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Patch attached below looks good, please commit. Thanks!

During this time, the pid field of the shadow_rec is 0. When the claim lease has expired, we don't want to send a signal when the pid is 0, as this causes the schedd to EXCEPT. [...] (By Jaime Frey )
